data.text:
John Hutton1

M, #343921, d. 16 January 1768

Last Edited=13 Mar 2020

John Hutton was the son of John Hutton and Dorothy Dyke.2 He married, firstly, Barbara Barker.2 He married, secondly, Hon. Elizabeth Darcy, daughter of James Darcy, 1st Baron Darcy of Navan and Anne Stawell, on 5 March 1726.1 He died on 16 January 1768.1

He lived at Marske, Yorkshire, England .1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S18] Matthew H.C.G., editor, Dictionary of National Biography on CD-ROM (Oxford, U.K.: Oxford University Press, 1995). Hereinafter cited as Dictionary of National Biography.

[S8481] Joseph Foster, Pedigrees of the County of Yorkshire, Volume 1 - West Riding (London: W. Wilfred Head, 1874), Croft Pedigree. Hereinafter cited as Pedigrees of the County of Yorkshire.

Hon. Isabel Darcy1

F, #343922

Last Edited=15 Mar 2009

Hon. Isabel Darcy was the daughter of James Darcy, 1st Baron Darcy of Navan and Anne Stawell.1 She died, unmarried.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Lady Ursula Darcy1

F, #343923, b. 1619, d. 30 July 1680

Last Edited=10 May 2011

Lady Ursula Darcy was born in 1619.2 She was the daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby.1 She married Sir Christopher Wyvill, 3rd Bt., son of Sir Marmaduke Wyvill, 2nd Bt. and Isabell Gascoigne, on 12 December 1636.1,2 She died on 30 July 1680.2 She was buried at St. Mary, Masham, Yorkshire, England .2

From 12 December 1636, her married name became Wyvill.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S18] Matthew H.C.G., editor, Dictionary of National Biography on CD-ROM (Oxford, U.K.: Oxford University Press, 1995). Hereinafter cited as Dictionary of National Biography.

Lady Elizabeth Darcy1

F, #343924, d. 1729

Last Edited=7 Jun 2015

Lady Elizabeth Stapylton

by William Wissing 2

Lady Elizabeth Darcy was the daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby.1 She married Sir Henry Stapylton, 1st Bt. on 18 October 1650.1 She died in 1729.2

From 18 October 1650, her married name became Stapylton.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S3409] Caroline Maubois, "re: Penancoet Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 2 December 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Penancoet Family."

[S339] Descendants of William the Conqueror, online http://www.william1.co.uk/. Hereinafter cited as Descendants of William the Conqueror.

Hon. Grace Darcy1

F, #343925, d. 1658

Last Edited=11 Nov 2013

Hon. Grace Darcy was the daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby.1 She married Sir John Legard, 1st Bt., son of John Legard and Mary Dawnay, on 18 October 1655.1 She died in 1658.1

From 18 October 1655, her married name became Legard.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Sir John Legard, 1st Bt.1

M, #343926, b. 1631, d. 1678

Last Edited=17 Nov 2013

Consanguinity Index=0.0%

Sir John Legard, 1st Bt. was born in 1631.2 He was the son of John Legard and Mary Dawnay.2 He married, firstly, Hon. Grace Darcy, daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby, on 18 October 1655.1 He married, secondly, Frances Widdrington, daughter of Sir Thomas Widdrington and Hon. Frances Fairfax, on 12 August 1658.2 He died in 1678.2

He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Scarborough in 1660.2 He was created 1st Baronet Legard, of Ganton, co. York [England] on 29 December 1660, following his early support for the Restoration.2

Child of Sir John Legard, 1st Bt. and Hon. Grace Darcy

unknown daughter Legard2

Children of Sir John Legard, 1st Bt. and Frances Widdrington

Dorothy Legard+2

Sir John Legard, 2nd Bt.+2 b. 16 Jun 1659, d. 5 May 1715

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Hon. Margaret Darcy1

F, #343927, d. 1660

Last Edited=20 Feb 2011

Hon. Margaret Darcy was the daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby.1 She married Sir Henry Marwood, 2nd Bt., son of Sir George Marwood, 1st Bt. and Frances Bethell, on 19 May 1658.1 She died in 1660, without male issue.1

From 19 May 1658, her married name became Marwood.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Sir Henry Marwood, 2nd Bt.1

M, #343928, b. circa 1635, d. 1 November 1725

Last Edited=30 Aug 2013

Sir Henry Marwood, 2nd Bt. was born circa 1635.2 He was the son of Sir George Marwood, 1st Bt. and Frances Bethell.2 He married Hon. Margaret Darcy, daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby, on 19 May 1658.1 He married Dorothy Bellingham, daughter of Alan Bellingham and Elizabeth Gilpin, on 6 July 1663 at Heversham, Westmorland, England.2 He died on 1 November 1725.2

He gained the title of 2nd Baronet Marwood.

Child of Sir Henry Marwood, 2nd Bt. and Dorothy Bellingham

George Marwood+2 b. 1665, d. 1700

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1028. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S3268] Hans Harmsen, "re: Chester Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 21 August 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Chester Family."

Hon. Anne Darcy1

F, #343929

Last Edited=20 Feb 2011

Hon. Anne Darcy was the daughter of Conyers Darcy, 1st Earl of Holderness and Grace Rokeby.1 She died, unmarried.1
